website_summaries.verdict: High-level glove modeled after one of the best pitchers in Major League Baseball, Clayton Kershaw.
pros: Sharp-looking pitcher's glove with an all-black design
Uses a soft material that's also durable for an easy break-in process
Includes a lining in the wrist area that keeps your hand dry from sweat
Two-pocket construction will hide the ball from the batter while you adjust your grip
Offered in both left- and right-hand fits
cons: Extremely expensive for a pitcher glove, especially for a young player just starting to pitch

customer_reviews.title: For My Son
customer_reviews.text: This was a new glove for my son, it is his third A2000 in as many years. He plays at the varsity high school/travel baseball level, so it will be his new glove for next season. The A2000 take a time to break in, but to me that's a good thing because you know they use quality leather and materials in the product. He loves the color scheme and the brand of glove.
customer_reviews.author: bigdaddymoose

customer_reviews.title: The Pitcher's Glove (B125) is 12.5" not 12"
customer_reviews.text: It seems like Wilson has changed this glove for 2019. I'm happy with the longer glove, but it was longer than expected based on the item description. A2000 is one of the best gloves on the market and the one I received is excellent in every way. Highly recommend this glove. It seems as though it will also be easy to break in. The leather is soft and supple. The padding just needs to be beaten into shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove with CLASSY looks
customer_reviews.text: The classic A2000 glove in a really nice-looking color combination. The gold trim adds a little flash and contrast to classic black without the garish look of the louder color combinations. Same quality Wilson leather, nice and stiff as delivered, but perfect after break-in. Feels like a natural extension of your hand. The ideal infielders’ glove.
customer_reviews.author: Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Glove for SMALL hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 16 year old for High School baseball. He is 5’9” and 145 lbs. It was so tight on his hand his fingers turned purple. Definitely a good durable glove, but for someone with a lot smaller hands. We exchanged for a little bigger glove and different style A2000.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Super stiff glove but that is what you want when buying a good quality leather glove. Fits my hand tight (Size Large Hand) but I like that because it will loosen up with time. Better than starting loose and having to tighten the strings. I had the glove steamed at DICKS for $25 - Highly recommend, breaks the glove in 50% of the way so you don't over stress and form it wrong! Should be ready to use in about 1 month playing catch twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Doing its job
customer_reviews.text: My 16-year-old son likes A2K He likes to break in the way he fields the ball. Yet, he doesn’t like “soft leather”. This one gives him just right amount of stiffness to do his job as at MIF. It may take a while to break in, but that’s what my son likes. So this product worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Mamakaz

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer.
customer_reviews.text: My HS/Travel Ball playing son has used this glove for almost a year and he has been very pleased. Good quality glove that is just soft enough but still maintains its integrity.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gregory

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This Baseball glove is one that will last. High quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: A2000 (winner winner chicken dinner)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome glove and a great deal! My son was super excited to get his new glove!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome glove
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son when he made varsity. He loves this glove. Took awhile to break in. He uses it all the time.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My son is loving his glove. Its nice and soft. We didn't have to do much to break it in before the season. My other son has a super expensive custom glove he never uses because its so stiff!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't ask for a better price on a great glove. Couldn't be happier with the quality of this mitt.

customer_reviews.title: Wilson A2000 is still the best glove.
customer_reviews.text: Wilson A2000 is probably still the best glove made. Lasts for a long time.

customer_reviews.text: Great glove. And to solve all the confusion, hand orientation is the hand the glove is worn on. Left hand orientation is for a right hand thrower

customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Took it to Dick's Sporting Goods had it steamed for $15 and it is excellent!!!

customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size 12 received a 12.5. Other than that it is a nice glove and my son likes it.

customer_reviews.title: In the big leagues now.
customer_reviews.text: After unloading hay for a month my son had enough money to buy this A2000. Ahh the personal relationship between a boy and his glove. And why not? This glove is buttery and beautiful. Came in two days thanks to Prime. I would suspect my son will hold this glove dear to heart for many years. The snap of a hard throw hitting the pocket of this glove is enough to make a game of catch a nightly occurrence. Performs well in games too! Huzzah!

customer_reviews.title: Faster-than-expected break-in period

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding glove.!
customer_reviews.text: This glove is outstanding. If you're looking for a great glove that looks sick while playing, this is it. Best glove I've ever used in my lifetime. Though it's an infield glove, it's great for catching fly balls as well. Really amazing glove. Recommend to anyone that asks what glove they should get.

customer_reviews.title: Stupid Purchase but Not One Second of Buyer's Remorse
customer_reviews.text: Best human/cow collaboration EVER! I haven't played competitive baseball in over 50 years but all those years vanish when I put this thing on. Now, if I can just find a neighbor to play catch with...

customer_reviews.title: Well made

product_meta.title: Wilson A2000 Baseball Glove Series
product_meta.description: Cy Young winner Clayton Kershaw knows what works, and he chooses to pitch with the A2000 CK22 GM. This baseball glove features a deep pocket and closed 2 piece web for total ball and grip concealment. Designed in black Pro Stock Leather, the A2000 CK22 conceals grip changes and is there for you on line drives too. Wilson spent decades working with MLB players to refine the A2000 baseball glove so that it outperforms and outlasts all others. Pro Stock patterns, developed by Master Craftsman Shigeaki Aso, are constructed with durable Pro Stock Leather to provide the performance MLB players demand game after game. The result is a ball glove that breaks in perfectly for hardworking players everywhere. - 11.75 Inch Model - Pitcher/Infield Model - Clayton Kershaw's Game Model Glove - 2-Piece Web - Pro Stock Leather for a long lasting glove and a great break-in - Dual Welting for a durable pocket - DriLex Wrist Lining to keep your hand cool and dry
feature_bullets: Wilson A2000 CK22 Clayton Kershaw Game Model 11.75" Pitcher's Baseball Glove
Pro Stock(TM) Leather for a long lasting glove and a great break-in
Dual Welting(TM) for a durable pocket
DriLex Wrist Lining to keep your hand cool and dry
